detail.content: MA Arts Politics: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Art & Public Policy Home Masters in Arts Politics Center for Art and Public Policy Course Offerings News and Events Faculty Twitter Facebook  home > Art and Public Policy > MA Arts Politics          The M.A. in Arts Politics:    An Activist, Critical, Interdisciplinary Graduate Program The politics that make art. The politics that art makes. This is an opportunity for artists and those working in the intellectual and institutional domains of art to enhance and elaborate the value and significance of their creative endeavors through intensive study, reflection, and engagement with the university and the world. Based at Tisch, the program combines a dedicated core faculty with access to faculty and courses from five different schools at New York University More  MA in Arts Politics Curriculum The M.A. is an intensive one year program in which students take 18 credits per semester.
